a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Homicide rate vs. GDP per capita, 2024

Homicide rate is measured as the number of
intentional homicide
deaths per 100,000 people. GDP per capita
is adjusted for inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.
Data source: UN, World Population Prospects (2024); United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (2025); Eurostat, OECD, and World Bank

Note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, this metric is
age-standardized
. GDP per capita is expressed in
